reviews.text: Thoroughly recommended for location, accommodation, standard of service, friendliness and the gourmet food. We cannot wait to return in the future.
reviews.title: Splendid Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights here at end of May. Weather was rather disappointing, but hotel made up for it - a tastefully converted old hall with annexe in outbuildings, ideally situated for Stratford and Cotswolds. Very relaxing/charming/English. Our bedroom (in main building, not the annexe) was spacious and very comfortable. Lovely.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I won a two-night stay in this hotel with dinner & breakfast, and we we had a very relaxing and romantic stay.
reviews.title: A grand stay!

likes.liked: — The beauty of the hall and the fantastic staff

reviews.text: Salford Hall is a grand historic building, located very near the A46. The main building is beautiful, with many of its orginal features restored. It only has 33 bedrooms but has all the facilities you would expect from a modern hotel as well as a tennis court, sauna and a snooker room. It has a good restuaraunt, bar and lounge area.
reviews.title: Wedding reception

reviews.text: We stayed in room 18, which was in the coach house. We didn't have a problem not staying in the main house, in fact, we quite liked it. There's something to be said for waking up, pulling the curtains and seeing a historic house just in front of you! The room was a decent size and styled to fit into the period of the hall. As previous reviews say, the shower and tv are unreliable but it didn't bother us that much. We preferred soaking in the deep bath and reading in the garden.
reviews.title: Classy...but not as good as it thinks

reviews.text: This was our 4th visit to Salford Hall and is likely to be our last.
reviews.title: Huge Disappointment

likes.disliked: — The room and food/service in restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had specifically booked a four poster room in the main hotel and not the annex part (because I wanted a room with character and charm, like the one featured in their brochure) for my Fiance's Birthday and we have friends who highly recommended one of the rooms. I made it quite clear at the time of booking that it had got to be in the main hotel and not the annex and the booking was accepted on this basis. However, when we checked in we were told we were in Room 36 in the annex. I explained that this was not acceptable. The Duty Manager then appeared who explained that they had got housekeeping problems. He showed us to Room 36 which was not what we were expecting at all, the carpet was filthy and the colour scheme depressing and drab. He did offer to personally make up a room in the main building for us but explained that it may not be up to standard as he is a man! We reluctantly accepted the room.
reviews.title: Filthy and freezing
